response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8‑inch round cake pans. In a large bowl whisk together 1½ cups flour, ¾ cup cocoa powder, 1½ tsp baking soda, ½ tsp baking powder, and ½ tsp salt. Set aside.",
  "step2": "In a separate bowl, beat 1 cup sugar and ½ cup melted butter until light. Add 2 eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each. Stir in 1 tsp vanilla and 1 cup buttermilk, blending until smooth.",
  "step3": "Combine dry and wet mixtures, pouring the batter into the prepared pans. Gently swirl with a knife to remove air pockets. Tap pans lightly on the counter to level the batter and release trapped bubbles.",
  "step4": "Bake for 25–30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cakes cool in pans for 10 minutes, then turn onto wire racks to cool completely before frosting.",
  "step5": "Whip ½ cup softened butter, 3 cups powdered sugar, ¼ cup cocoa powder, 2 tbsp milk, and 1 tsp vanilla until fluffy. Spread a thin layer on the first cake, stack the second, and apply a crumb coat. Chill 15 minutes to set the coat.",
  "step6": "Finish frosting with the remaining buttercream, smoothing edges with a spatula. Decorate with chocolate shavings or sprinkles. Slice, serve, and enjoy a moist, rich chocolate cake for eight guests."
}
